title: All color palettes
text: following vignettes provide overview examples using unicol color palettes:

title: Using color palettes
text: Task: Using unicol colors visualizations created base R graphics. unicol color palettes typically provided named vectors color objects. Thus, creating base R visualizations (e.g., using plot() creating scatterplot), can directly use color palette col argument. instance, let’s assume wanted create bar chart using color palette uni_bonn_2 (University Bonn, Germany):  can simply provide color palette col argument barplot() function:  case want modify color palette (e.g., change number colors add transparency) using , can using usecol() function unikn package providing modified palette col argument R graphics function. following examples illustrate alternatives.  Directly using color palette (e.g., color palette caltech_1):  Using transformed color palette (using usecol() function unikn package resizing adding transparency palette):
code: # View color palette: unikn::seecol(uni_bonn_2, main = "Color gradient of the University of Bonn, Germany") # Use a color palette: barplot(1/sqrt(1:10), col = uni_bonn_2) # View color palette: unikn::seecol(caltech_1, main = "The colors of Caltech, USA") plot(x = runif(99), y = runif(99), type = "p",       pch = 16, cex = 4,      col = caltech_1,      main = "99 dots (in Caltech colors)", axes = FALSE, xlab = NA, ylab = NA) my_col <- unikn::usecol(caltech_1, alpha = .60)  # with transparency  plot(x = runif(99), y = runif(99), type = "p",       pch = 16, cex = 4,      col = my_col,      main = "99 transparent dots", axes = FALSE, xlab = NA, ylab = NA)

title: Using color palettes
text: Task: Using unicol colors visualizations created ggplot2 package. using ggplot() function ggplot2 (e.g., creating area plot), wrap color palette usecol() function (unikn package) defining color palette (desired length transparency). resulting color palette can provided values ggplot2’s scale_color_manual() scale_fill_manual() functions: Wrap desired color palette usecol() function unikn. Provide palette values ggplot2 functions scale_color_manual() scale_fill_manual().
code: # 0. Create some data to plot: ----   # Example based on https://r-graph-gallery.com/137-spring-shapes-data-art/ n <- 50 groups <- 1:n df <- data.frame()  set.seed(3)  for (i in seq(1:30)){   data = data.frame(matrix(0, n, 3))   data[, 1] <- i   data[, 2] <- sample(groups, nrow(data))   data[, 3] <- prop.table(sample(c(rep(0, 100), c(1:n)), nrow(data)))   df = rbind(df, data)}  names(df) <- c("X","Group","Y") df$Group <- as.factor(df$Group)   df <- df[c(2, 1, 3)] df <- df[order(df$X, df$Group) , ] rownames(df) <- NULL  my_data <- df  # # View data (as wider table): # my_data_wider <- tidyr::pivot_wider(my_data, names_from = Group, names_prefix = "g_", values_from = Y) # knitr::kable(my_data_wider, caption = "Viewing data (in wider format).")   # 1. Colors: ----   # A. Using RColorBrewer:  # library(RColorBrewer)  # my_pal <- brewer.pal(11, "Paired") # my_pal <- colorRampPalette(my_pal)(n) # my_pal <- my_pal[sample(c(1:length(my_pal)), size = length(my_pal))]  # randomize  # B. Using unicol colors: library(unicol)  # Mix a color gradient:  my_pal <- unikn::usecol(princeton_1, n = 50) # my_pal <- my_pal[sample(c(1:length(my_pal)), size = length(my_pal))]  # randomize   # 2. Plotting (with ggplot2): ----   library(ggplot2)  ggplot2::ggplot(my_data, aes(x = X, y = Y, fill = Group)) +    geom_area() +   scale_fill_manual(values = my_pal) +   theme_void() +   theme(legend.position = "none")

title: The Colors of your University
text: latest release unicol available CRAN https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=unicol: current development version can installed GitHub repository https://github.com/hneth/unicol/: unicol package based R package unikn requires key functionality.
code: install.packages('unicol')  # install from CRAN client library('unicol')           # load the package # install.packages('devtools')  # install pkg devtools::install_github('hneth/unicol')

title: The Colors of your University
text: unicol package provides colors color palettes, whereas unikn package provides color-related functions:
code: library(unicol)  # for color palettes library(unikn)   # for color functions

title: The Colors of your University
text: unicol package currently provides 269 color palettes 116 institutions. (See vignette color palettes overview included color palettes institutions.)

title: The Colors of your University
text: Figure 1 illustrates 50 random color palettes (202 colors): Figure 1: sample 50 unicol palettes (containing 202 colors).

title: The Colors of your University
text: unicol palettes provided vectors R colors, can simply used col argument R graphics functions. instance, can use MIT colors (Massachusetts Institute Technology) bar plot (barplot() function base R graphics package) follows:  modify color palette (e.g., resizing palette adding transparency), use usecol() function unikn package:  additional examples color palettes unicol can used:
code: barplot(height = 1:10,         col = mit,          main = "Using the MIT colors") barplot(height = 1/sqrt(1:16),          col = usecol(mit, n = 16),          main = "A color gradient of MIT colors") # Viewing a color palette: unikn::seecol(yale, main = "The primary colors of Yale University") # Demo plots: unikn::demopal(berkeley_1, type = 2, main = "The colors of Berkeley, University of California", seed = 3) unikn::demopal(limerick_1, type = 3, main = "Using the colors of the University of Limerick", seed = 3)

title: Primary colours of the University College Cork, Ireland — ucc_1
text: 6 primary colours  Crest yellow, defined Pantone 7549C, C0 M20 Y100 K0, R255 G181 B0, HEX "#FFB500",  Crest red, defined Pantone 1795C, C0 M96 Y90 K2, R206 G31 B44, HEX "#CE1F2C",  Crest blue, defined Pantone 2955C, C100 M45 Y10 K37, R0 G60 B105, HEX "#003C69",  Crest black, defined "black", Pantone Black, C0 M0 Y0 K100, R0 G0 B0, HEX "#000000",  Crest white, defined "white", C0 M0 Y0 K0, R255 G255 B255, HEX "#FFFFFF",   Crest black tint, defined C0 M0 Y0 K6, R239 G239 B240, HEX "#EFEFF0". ucc_1 uses HEX color definitions. colours used university level  (coated uncoated paper). Colour plays important part UCC's identity  renders communications consistent cohesive. primary colour palette uses four colours crest. communications bold use white space key element  UCC's use colour.  choosing colour complement photography, care taken  ensure compatible. Please use tints colours except colours indicated.

title: General colors of the University of Regensburg, Germany — uni_regensburg_1
text: Named colors uni_regensburg_1 correspond following UR services: neutralgrau: Main color (UR-Hausfarbe, Logo) blaugrau: Leitung, Organe und Verwaltung (LOV, Ausnahme: Referate /3, /4, /5, /6) schwarzrot: Chancengleichheit und Familie (Familien-Service, Frauenbeauftragte, Frauenfoerderung, Gleichstellung) schilfgruen: Service-Einrichtungen der Verwaltung für Studierende (Akademisches Auslandsamt, Studentenkanzlei, Zentrales Pruefungssekretariat, Zentrale Studienberatung, Senatsbeauftragter für Behinderte und chronisch Kranke) dianthusrot: Universitaetsbibliothek (UB) saphirblau: Rechenzentrum (RZ) farngruen: Zentrum fuer Weiterbildung rotbraun: Zentrum fuer Sprache und Kommunikation (ZSK) perlviolett: Europaeum (Ost-West-Zentrum) violettrot: Zentrum fuer Hochschul- und Wissenschaftsdidaktik (ZHW) gruenbraun: Regensburger Universitätszentrum fuer Lehrerbildung (RUL) wasserblau: Sportzentrum (SZ) coloring large areas, named colors may used shades 70

code: uni_regensburg_1 #> neutralgrau    blaugrau  schwarzrot schilfgruen dianthusrot  saphirblau  #>   "#8E8E8D"   "#1D3F4B"   "#5F002F"   "#3D4100"   "#A46674"   "#032352"  #>   farngruen    rotbraun perlviolett  violettrot  gruenbraun  wasserblau  #>   "#416224"   "#724B51"   "#564E6F"   "#3B0041"   "#866800"   "#00817B"  unikn::seecol(uni_regensburg_1, main = "General colors of the University of Regensburg")  unikn::demopal(uni_regensburg_1, alpha = .70, type = 2,                 main = "General colors of Regensburg University")

title: unicol 0.3.0
text: unicol (v0.3.0) published CRAN. [2024-05-01] version adds new color palettes improves package maintenance. unicol package currently provides 269 color palettes 116 institutions. Changes since last release:

title: unicol 0.3.0
text: Aalto University (Finland): aalto_1, aalto_2 Aarhus University (Denmark): aarhus Lund University (Sweden): lund_1, lund_2, lund_3 Martin Luther University Halle-Wittenberg (Germany): uni_halle University Bangor (Wales, UK): bangor_1, bangor_2, bangor_3, bangor_4 University Bergen (Norway): bergen_1, bergen_2, bergen_3, bergen_4 University Copenhagen (Denmark): ku_1, ku_2 University Gothenburg (Sweden): gothenburg University Helsinki (Finland): helsinki_1, helsinki_2, helsinki_3 University Magdeburg (Germany): uni_magdeburg_1, uni_magdeburg_2, uni_magdeburg_3 University Oslo (Norway): oslo University Stirling (Scotland, UK): stirling_1, stirling_2, stirling_3 University Stockholm (Sweden): stockholm_1, stockholm_2 Uppsala University (Sweden): uppsala Columbia University (USA): 3 new color palettes (columbia_1, columbia_2, columbia_3) replace former columbia_v0 palette Color palettes linked online documentation current GitHub development version.

title: unicol 0.3.0
text: rename colors color palettes (consistency simplicity) replace logo image

title: unicol 0.3.0
text: improve documentation examples development version unicol available https://github.com/hneth/unicol/.

title: unicol 0.2.0
text: CRAN release: 2023-09-15 unicol (v0.2.0) published CRAN. [2023-09-15] version adds updates color palettes, also improves consistency, simplicity, fixes bugs. unicol package currently provides 236 color palettes 102 institutions. Changes since last release:

title: unicol 0.2.0
text: Aberystwyth University (Wales, UK): aberystwyth_1, aberystwyth_2 Cardiff University (Wales, UK): cardiff_1, cardiff_2 Macquarie University (Australia): mq_1, mq_2 Maynooth University (Ireland): maynooth Ohio University (USA): ohio_uni_1, ohio_uni_2 University College Cork (Ireland): ucc_1, ucc_2 University College Dublin (Ireland): ucd University Auckland (New Zealand): auckland_1, auckland_2 University Groningen (Netherlands): groningen_1, groningen_2 University Lisbon (Portugal): uni_lisbon University Otago (New Zealand): otago University Nottingham (England, UK): nottingham_1, nottingham_2, nottingham_3 University Wollongong (Australia): wollongong_1, wollongong_2 Willamette University (USA): willamette Humboldt University Berlin (Germany): hu_1, hu_1_digital, hu_2, hu_3_accent (previous palettes now hu_1_2022 hu_2_2022) Trinity College Dublin (Ireland): trinity_2 corrected UCLA (USA): added ucla_4 creating color gradients

title: unicol 0.2.0
